Bonesplitterz (Age of Sigmar) [2,100pts]

  • **Pitched Battle** 2,000 (Destruction - Bonesplitterz) [2,100pts]

    • Leader [380pts]

      • Maniak Weirdnob [120pts]

        Categories: WIZARD, DESTRUCTION, Orruk, BONESPLITTERZ, HERO, Maniak Weirdnob, Leader

        Magic: Maniak Weirdnob, Spell: Arcane Bolt, Bone Spirit, Mystic Shield, Unit: Maniak Weirdnob, Unit Abilities: Ju-ju Squig, Tusker Charge, Weapon: Bonebeast Staff, War Boar’s Tusks


        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Maniak Weirdnob 1/1Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield and Bone Spirit
        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Arcane Bolt 5If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If the casting roll was 10 or more, the unit suffers D3 mortal wounds instead.
        Bone Spirit 4If successfully cast, you can re-roll hit rolls of 1 for the caster and any friendly units of BONESPLITTERZthat are within 10" when they attack until your next hero phase. If the casting roll was a double and the spell was cast, the caster and the affected units can re-roll all failed hit rolls.
        Mystic Shield 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. Re-roll save rolls of 1 for that unit until your next hero phase.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Maniak Weirdnob 9"676+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Ju-ju Squig A Maniak Weirdnob’s ju-ju squig is filled with Waaagh! energy. Once per battle, a Maniak Weirdnob can unleash this energy to re-roll a failed casting roll.
        Tusker Charge Re-roll failed wound rolls when attacking with this model’s War Boar’s Tusks if it charged in the same turn.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Bonebeast Staff Melee1"14+3+-D3

      • Savage Big Boss [120pts]

        Categories: DESTRUCTION, Orruk, BONESPLITTERZ, HERO, Savage Big Boss, Leader

        Command Abilities: Savage Attack, Unit: Savage Big Boss, Unit Abilities: Let Me At ’Em, Weapon: Boss Cleava


        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Savage Attack With a guttural bellow and a swing of their axe, the Savage Big Boss orders an all-out attack upon the foe. If a Savage Big Boss uses this ability, you can select a BONESPLITTERZunit within 10". Until your next hero phase, whenever you make a hit roll of 6 or more for a model in that unit, it can immediately make one extra attack using the same weapon.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Savage Big Boss 5"676+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Let Me At ’Em A Savage Big Boss cannot wait to get to grips with the foe, and this inspires any Bonesplitterz nearby to get into the fight as soon as possible. After this model has fought in the combat phase for the first time, you can pick a friendly Bonesplitterz unit that has not yet fought in that combat phase and which is within 3" of an enemy unit and within 10" of this model. That unit fights immediately, before the opposing player picks a unit to fight in that combat phase. That unit cannot fight again in that combat phase unless an ability or spell allows it to fight more than once.’
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Boss Cleava Melee1"53+3+-12

      • Wurrgog Prophet [140pts]

        Categories: DESTRUCTION, Orruk, BONESPLITTERZ, HERO, WIZARD, Wurrgog Prophet, Leader

        Command Abilities: Prophet of da Waaagh!, Magic: Wurrgog Prophet, Spell: Arcane Bolt, Fists of Gork, Mystic Shield, Unit: Warrgog Prophet, Unit Abilities: Beast Mask, Weapon: Flint Knife, Ju-Ju Staff, Squiggly Beast’s Fanged Maw


        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Prophet of da Waaagh! If a Wurrgog Prophet uses this ability, select a BONESPLITTERZunit within 15". That unit can immediately pile in and attack as if it were the combat phase. This does not prevent the unit from attacking again later. The same unit cannot be picked to benefit from this command ability more than once per hero phase.
        Magic Cast/UnbindSpells Known Ref
        Wurrgog Prophet 2/2Arcane Bolt, Mystic Shield, and Fists of Gork
        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Arcane Bolt 5If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. That unit suffers 1 mortal wound. If the casting roll was 10 or more, the unit suffers D3 mortal wounds instead.
        Fists of Gork 8If successfully cast, pick an enemy unit within 18". Roll one dice for each model in the unit that is visible to the caster. The unit suffers 1 mortal wound for each roll of 6. If the casting roll was a double and the spell was cast, the unit suffers a mortal wound for each roll of 5 or more instead.
        Mystic Shield 6If successfully cast, pick a friendly unit within 18" of the caster that is visible to them. Re-roll save rolls of 1 for that unit until your next hero phase.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Warrgog Prophet 5"685+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Beast Mask Subtract 1 from any hit rolls that target a Wurrgog Prophet in the combat phase.
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Flint Knife Melee1"24+4+-1

        Bone Shield Savage Boarboys have a Save of 5+ in the combat phase.
        Hit & Run Units of Savage Boarboys can charge in the same turn that they retreat.”
        Savage Boar Boss The leader of this unit is a Savage Boar Boss. A Savage Boar Boss makes 2 attacks rather than 1 with their Chompa or Boar Stikka
        Tusker Charge Re-roll failed wound rolls when attacking with War Boars’ Tusks if this unit charged in the same turn

        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Aim Fer Its Eyes Stinga Bows have a Rend of -1 against MONSTERS
        Loadsa Arrows Savage Orruk Arrowboys make 1 extra attack with their Stinga Bows if their unit has 20 or more models.
        Savage Orruk Arrow Boss The leader of this unit is a Savage Orruk Arrow Boss. A Savage Orruk Arrow Boss wields a Chompa in combat instead of Arrows. Furthermore, you can add 1 to any hit roll made by a Savage Orruk Arrow Boss when they shoot their Stinga Bow.

        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Da Final Fling If a Big Stabba team is slain, with their final breath they hurl their Gork Toof at the foe. Pick an enemy unit within 3" of the Big Stabba team before the model is removed. That unit suffers D3 mortal wounds.
        Monster Hunters Add D3 to the Damage inflicted by a Gork Toof if the target is a MONSTER.

    • Battalion [480pts]

      • Battalion: Kunnin' Rukk [320pts]

        Categories: Battalion

        Battalion Abilities: Dead Sneaky

        • Savage Big Boss [120pts]

          Categories: DESTRUCTION, Orruk, BONESPLITTERZ, HERO, Savage Big Boss, Leader

          Command Abilities: Savage Attack, Unit: Savage Big Boss, Unit Abilities: Let Me At ’Em, Weapon: Boss Cleava


        Battalion Abilities Battalion Ability Details Ref
        Dead Sneaky Orruks can be surprisingly sneaky when they want, catching out a foe with an unexpected advance or a sudden sneak attack. In each of your hero phases, pick one unit from the Kunnin’ Rukk that is within 10" of the battalion’s Savage Big Boss. The unit you pick can move as if it were the movement phase if it is more than 3" from the enemy (and is allowed to run), shoot as if it were the shooting phase, or pile in and attack as if it were the combat phase if it is within 3" of an enemy. It can still perform actions normally later in the turn, whatever it does in the hero phase.
        Command Abilities Command Ability Details Ref
        Savage Attack With a guttural bellow and a swing of their axe, the Savage Big Boss orders an all-out attack upon the foe. If a Savage Big Boss uses this ability, you can select a BONESPLITTERZunit within 10". Until your next hero phase, whenever you make a hit roll of 6 or more for a model in that unit, it can immediately make one extra attack using the same weapon.
        Unit MoveWoundsBraverySave Ref
        Savage Big Boss 5"676+
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Let Me At ’Em A Savage Big Boss cannot wait to get to grips with the foe, and this inspires any Bonesplitterz nearby to get into the fight as soon as possible. After this model has fought in the combat phase for the first time, you can pick a friendly Bonesplitterz unit that has not yet fought in that combat phase and which is within 3" of an enemy unit and within 10" of this model. That unit fights immediately, before the opposing player picks a unit to fight in that combat phase. That unit cannot fight again in that combat phase unless an ability or spell allows it to fight more than once.’
        Weapon TypeRangeAttacksTo HitTo WoundRendDamage Ref
        Boss Cleava Melee1"53+3+-12

      • Super Battalion: Icebone Warclan [160pts]

        Categories: Battalion, ICEBONE

        Battalion Abilities: Freezin’ Weapons, Tundra Striderz


        Battalion Abilities Battalion Ability Details Ref
        Freezin’ Weapons The weapons of the Icebone Warclans slow and weaken their monstrous quarry. If an enemy MONSTERsuffers any wounds from a model from an Icebone Warclan in the combat phase, it can only be selected to attack that phase once all other eligible units have attacked.
        Tundra Striderz Icebone Warclans use only the hardiest warboars to track their prey at great speed. Icebone Savage Boarboys, Savage Boarboy Maniaks and Maniak Weirdnobs have a Move of 11" instead of 9".

    • Allegiance

      • Allegiance

        Categories: Allegiance

        • Bonesplitterz

          Battle Trait: Monster Hunters, Warpaint, D6: 1-2; Wild Abandon, 3-4; Stab! Stab! Stab!, 5-6; Berserk Strength


        Battle Trait Battle Trait Details Ref
        Monster Hunters If a BONESPLITTERZ unit kills a MONSTER in the combat phase, the released spirit imbues them with the courage of a fierce beast. The unit does not need to take battleshock tests until your next hero phase. In addition, if a BONESPLITTERZ unit is chosen to make its attacks in the combat phase and it is within 3" of an enemy MONSTER, roll a dice before piling in and consult the attached table.
        Warpaint When making a save roll for a BONESPLITTERZ model, a dice result of 6 (before modifiers) is always a successful save. This means there is always a chance of passing a save roll, regardless of the attack’s Rend. Furthermore, roll a dice each time a BONESPLITTERZ model suffers a mortal wound; on a 6, that mortal wound is ignored as the warpaint somehow saves the orruk from harm.
        D6 Monster Hunters Result Ref
        1-2; Wild Abandon The unit can pile in 6" this phase, instead of only 3".
        3-4; Stab! Stab! Stab! You can reroll any failed wound rolls for models in the unit that direct their attacks against a MONSTER this phase.
        5-6; Berserk Strength Each time a model in this unit rolls a wound roll of 6 or more against a MONSTER in this phase, the MONSTER suffers a mortal wound in addition to the normal damage.

      • Game Type

        Selections: 2000 Points - Battlehost

        Categories: Game Options, Battlehost

    • Malign Sorcery [50pts]

      • Endless Spell: Emerald Lifeswarm [50pts]

        Categories: ENDLESS SPELL, EMERALD LIFESWORM, GHYRAN, Malign Sorcery

        Spell: Summon Emerald Lifeswarm, Unit Abilities: Bounteous Healing, Empowered by Ghyran, Fly, Predatory


        Spell Casting ValueDescription Ref
        Summon Emerald Lifeswarm 6If successfully cast, set up an Emerald Lifeswarm model wholly within 15" of the caster.
        Unit Abilities Ability Details Ref
        Bounteous Healing After this model is set up or after it has moved, pick 1 unit within 1" of it. You can either heal D3 wounds that have been allocated to that unit or, if no wounds are currently allocated to the unit, you may return a number of slain models to it that have a combined Wounds characteristic equal to or less than the roll of a D3.
        Empowered by Ghyran If your battle is taking place in the Realm of Life, roll a D6 to determine the number of wounds healed or wounds worth of slain models returned by the Emerald Lifeswarm’s Bounteous Healing ability.
        Fly This unit can fly.
        Predatory An Emerald Lifeswarm is a predatory endless spell. Emerald Lifeswarms can move up to 10" and can fly.
